DataElement.preferredName: Maintenance and/or Consolidation Therapy Administered Prior to Metastatic Tissue Collection Name
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term that describes the name of the maintanence and/or consolidation therapy administered to an individual prior to metastatic tissue collection.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Maintenance And/Or Consolidation Therapy Prior To Metastatic Tissue Collection Administered
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The act of sustaining something in its current form or proper condition; upkeep._Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid._Treatment that is given after cancer has disappeared following the initial therapy. Consolidation therapy is used to kill any cancer cells that may be left in the body. It may include radiation therapy, a stem cell transplant, or treatment with drugs that kill cancer cells._Earlier in time or order._Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement._A term referring to the clinical or pathologic observation of a tumor extension from its original site of growth to another anatomic site._A repository of the tissue specimen, cells or cell lines, for experimental purpose. It can be from different diseases or different parts of the body._The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The act of sustaining something in its current form or proper condition; upkeep.:Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.:Treatment that is given after cancer has disappeared following the initial therapy. Consolidation therapy is used to kill any cancer cells that may be left in the body. It may include radiation therapy, a stem cell transplant, or treatment with drugs that kill cancer cells.

Concepts.definition: The act of sustaining something in its current form or proper condition; upkeep.
Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.
Treatment that is given after initial therapy to kill any remaining cancer cells.

Property.preferredName: Prior To Metastatic Tissue Collection Administered
Property.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.:A term referring to the clinical or pathologic observation of a tumor extension from its original site of growth to another anatomic site.:A repository of the tissue specimen, cells or cell lines, for experimental purpose. It can be from different diseases or different parts of the body.:The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

Concepts.definition: Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.
A term referring to the clinical or pathologic observation of a tumor extension from its original site of growth to another anatomic site.
A repository of the tissue specimen, cells or cell lines, for experimental purpose. It can be from different diseases or different parts of the body.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for Follow-up and metastasis CDE request 3.5.18 mc

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the name of the type of therapy.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The words or language units by which a thing is known.

Concepts.definition: The words or language units by which a thing is known.

ReferenceDocuments.description: Maintenance and/or consolidation therapy administered prior to collection of metastatic tissue
